ca.cgjennings.spelling.policy

Interface WordPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PhoneticHashProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWordPolicy, AcceptPolicy, BasicPolicy, LocalePolicy, NoOpPolicy, Policy_de, Policy_en, Policy_es, Policy_fr, Policy_it, PolicyChain

    public interface WordPolicy
extends PhoneticHashProvider
    Word policies modify how words are handled by a spell checker. Usually they provide some kind of locale-specific handling of the word.

    Before a word is checked by the dictionary, it is submitted to the registered word policy. The policy can modify the word being checked, or cause it to be accepted as a correct word without being looked up in the dictionary. For example, a policy could be set to accept "words" that consist of all digits, or to replace any word ending in "'s" to drop the possessive suffix.

    In addition, a WordPolicy defines a set of policy hints that control the behaviour of the spell checker. Policy hints are fetched and set using one of the keys in WordPolicy.Hint. The default value for a hint may be fetched by calling the hint's getDefault() method.

    Finally, a policy may provide an algorithm for phonetic evaluation of a word. If an algorithm is provided, it can be used to improve the suggestions provided for misspelled words.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  WordPolicy.Evaluation 
      static class  WordPolicy.Hint
      A policy hint can be used to modify the behaviour of the spell checker.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        Object evaluate(String word)
        Evaluate a word under this policy. The policy can return the original string, causing the word to be checked normally. Alternatively, it can return a different string as a proxy word to be checked instead of the original word. Finally, it can return one of the special values Evaluation.REJECT_WORD or Evaluation.ACCEPT_WORD. These cause the word to immediately be either rejected as a misspelled word or accepted as a correctly spelled word, respectively.
        Parameters:
        word - the word being checked by the caller
        Returns:
        the word to be looked up, or an Evaluation code

      • getHint

        Object getHint(WordPolicy.Hint key)
        Return the value of a policy hint.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to fetch a hint for
        Returns:
        the value for the requested hint

      • getPhoneticHash

        String getPhoneticHash(String word)
        Return a hash code representing how a string is pronounced. This can be used to help rank spelling suggestions, so that words that sound more similar are favoured more highly.

        Policies that do not provide a phonetic hashing algorithm must throw UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        getPhoneticHash in interface PhoneticHashProvider
        Parameters:
        word - the word to obtain a hash code for
        Returns:
        the phonetic hash of the word
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the policy does not support phonetic hashing
        See Also:
        hasPhonetics()

      • getTypistErrorModel

        TypistErrorModel getTypistErrorModel()
        Returns a model of keys that are frequently mistaken for each other while typing. This can be used to improve the quality of suggestions.
        Returns:
        a model of common typing errors

      • hasPhonetics

        boolean hasPhonetics()
        Return true if this policy can perform phonetic hashing.
        Returns:
        true if getPhoneticHash(java.lang.String) is supported

      • modifySuggestion

        String modifySuggestion(String word,
                        String suggestion)
        Allows the policy to modify a suggested replacement before it is returned to the user if it wishes. This can be used in combination with evaluate(java.lang.String) to transparently modify the words that are queried and fetched from the dictionary. For example, if the policy strips off affixes in evaluate, this method could be used to add the appropriate affixes back onto suggestion words so that the affixes on the suggestions agree with those of the mismatched word. If the policy does not wish to modify the suggestion, it should return suggestion unchanged.
        Parameters:
        word - the word for which suggestions have been requested
        suggestion - a suggested replacement for the word
        Returns:
        the original suggestion or a replacement
